p: The ash content, which ranged from 2.5 to 3.2 g/100 g DW, agrees with the 2.8 g/100 g and 3.6â€“3.8 g/100 g DW reported by Abiodun and Adepeju [ 51] and Kaptso, Njintang [ 34], respectively. All pre-treated flours had a higher ash content than the flour from raw seeds, agreeing with Nti [ 35], who reported an increase in ash content after dehulling. The effect of pre-treatment on ash content was significantly higher in the red variety than in the black-eye variety (p = 0.000). Within pre-treatments, only the roasted and combined soaking and roasted flour had comparable ash contents. The flour from soaked seeds had a lower ash content.
